description: First digit after decimal point of square root of n.
comments: When n is a square, a(n) is equal to 0, but the reciprocal is not true, see A034096. - _Michel Marcus_, Sep 21 2015
links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A023961 := proc(n) return floor(10*sqrt(n)) mod 10: end: seq(A023961(n),n=1..100); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 04 2011
mathematica: Array[ Function[ n, RealDigits[ N[ Power[ n, 1/2 ], 10 ], 10 ]// (#[ [ 1, #[ [ 2 ] ]+1 ] ])& ], 110 ]fd[n_]:=Module[{rd=RealDigits[Sqrt[n],10,10]},First[rd][[Last[rd]+1]]]; Array[fd,90] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 16 2014 *)
